Sequence Information.Function: Potent anti-inflammatory agent. At low concentrations, mediates the degranulation of mast cells thus evoking an inflammatory response. Also acts as a neurotoxin capable of blocking a class of voltage-gated potassium channels.

Literature.Title: The precursors of the bee venom constituents apamin and MCD peptide are encoded by two genes in tandem which share the same 3
Amino acid sequence of MCD-peptide, a specific mast cell-degranulating peptide from bee venom.
Literature.Author: Haux P.

Literature.Title: Identification by mass spectrometry of N(epsilon)-formyl-lysine.
Literature.Author: Vernon C.A.,Loudon A.G.,Hanson J.M.,Garman A.J.,Doonan S.

Literature.Title: An anti-inflammatory peptide from bee venom.
Literature.Author: Vernon C.A.,Shipolini R.A.,Hanson J.M.,Morley J.,Billingham M.E.J.

Literature.Title: Mast cell degranulating peptide: a multi-functional neurotoxin.
Literature.Author: Blume A.J.,Beer B.,Wang H.-C.,Russek S.,Ziai M.R.
